meanings.definition: The condition of a plant in which the upper surface of a leaf is more convex than the lower surface.
meanings.sent1: The epinasty of the leaf made it look like a little boat sailing in the wind.
meanings.sent2: The epinasty of the leaf helps it capture more sunlight for photosynthesis.
meanings.sent3: The epinasty of the leaf was so pronounced that it seemed to be waving hello to the other plants.
meanings.sent4: The epinasty of the leaf was like a smile, always facing towards the sun.
meanings.sent5: The epinasty of the leaf created a cozy shelter for tiny insects.

meanings.definition: The abnormal growth of plant tissues in which one part is bent or curved downward.
meanings.sent1: The epinasty of the stem caused it to droop sadly towards the ground.
meanings.sent2: The epinasty of the plant's stem was a result of a genetic mutation.
meanings.sent3: The epinasty of the stem made it look like the plant was trying to touch its toes.
meanings.sent4: The epinasty of the stem was a reminder that even plants can have bad hair days.
meanings.sent5: The epinasty of the stem gave the plant a unique, cascading appearance.
